The team found tent, sleeping equipment, GPS and national and Arunachal Pradesh's flags. The mountaineers had gone missing while climbing Chiumo's peak close to the India-China border.

175.title: I feel ashamed as Indian: Kerala Guv on killings of Kashmiri Pandits
175.article_body: Reacting to the targeted killings of Kashmiri Pandits, Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan said he feels ashamed as an Indian. He added, "There can be no greater crime than...the killing of an innocent [person]." Khan further said, "If a single person from my country has to leave his home and become a refugee, no amount of shame will suffice it."

176.title: Police seizes 3,243 kg sacks of cannabis at Assam-Tripura border
176.article_body: Assam Police in Karimganj seized 3,243 kg of cannabis at the Assam-Tripura border check-post on Monday. Police said the contraband was packed in 93 jute bags and was being smuggled to Guwahati in a truck from the neighbouring state. "Another major feat by Assam Police in its drive against drugs...One accused has been apprehended," tweeted Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma.

177.title: 'No space left for talks': Zelenskyy as Russia targets power infra
177.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Tuesday said there was "no space left for negotiations" with his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin following the latest spate of Russian air strikes targeting Ukrainian energy and critical infrastructure. "Since Oct 10, 30% of Ukraine's power stations have been destroyed, causing massive blackouts across the country," Zelenskyy said in a tweet.

178.title: Puducherry to have medical college offering MBBS course in Tamil: Governor
178.article_body: Lieutenant Governor of Puducherry Tamilisai Soundararajan said that the government is planning to start a medical college offering the MBBS course in Tamil medium. She said she would also consult Chief Minister N Rangasamy to work out the logistics to open such a college. "A committee will be formed to prepare books in Tamil for medical education," she added.

179.title: Karnataka Congress launches 'Say CM' campaign against state govt
179.article_body: The Karnataka Congress launched a new campaign called 'SayCM' to talk about the alleged unfulfilled 2018 poll promises of the state's BJP government. "Answers should be given to the people...Should they pay 40% commission even to talk about their party's manifesto promises?" Congress tweeted. They also put a QR code that takes users to the '40% Sarkara' website.

180.title: 16-yr-old girl tries to sell her blood to buy smartphone in Bengal
180.article_body: A 16-year-old girl allegedly approached a blood bank in West Bengal on Monday to sell her blood so she could buy a smartphone. The blood bank authorities informed Childline India and the girl was counselled before being handed over to her parents. The girl told authorities that she had already ordered a smartphone worth ₹9,000 online.

181.title: Will work on reducing injuries to players, improving pitches: BCCI President Roger Binny
181.article_body: Newly-elected BCCI President Roger Binny said he'd primarily focus on reducing injuries to players and improving pitches in India. Roger said injury to Jasprit Bumrah just before T20 World Cup 2022 affected Team India's "whole plan". He added, "There needs to be more life in...wickets at home, so our teams wouldn't have the problem of adjusting when travelling abroad."

182.title: Jayalalithaa's legs weren't amputated, no slow poisoning: Inquiry Commission
182.article_body: There's no evidence to suggest that former Tamil Nadu CM J Jayalalithaa's legs were amputated while in hospital or that she was administered slow poison, according to Justice Arumughaswamy Commission's report. "This evidence is nothing but a mere surmise," the report said. It also rejected allegations that Jayalalithaa was assaulted on her head with a wooden log.

183.title: Haryana government hikes Dearness Allowance by 4% to 38%
183.article_body: Haryana government has hiked the Dearness Allowance (DA) of its employees drawing salaries as per the 7th Pay Commission by 4% to 38%. The increased DA will be paid with salaries of October 2022 while arrears for the July-September 2022 period will be paid in November 2022. The Centre had also hiked DA of its employees by 4% in September.

184.title: Something to cherish for lifetime: Jaffer on Meiyappan's hat-trick in T20 WC
184.article_body: Reacting to UAE spinner Karthik Meiyappan's hat-trick against Sri Lanka in T20 World Cup 2022, Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter and wrote, "That's a quality hat-trick. Congratulations...Meiyappan, something to cherish for [a] lifetime." UAE skipper CP Rizwan said, "He bowled beautifully...He's a special bowler." The 22-year-old dismissed Bhanuka Rajapaksa, Charith Asalanka and captain Dasun Shanaka.

185.title: Police seize ₹19 lakh from Congress leader in Munugode, 1 arrested
185.article_body: Police on Tuesday arrested one person and seized ₹19 lakh from a vehicle on the outskirts of Telangana's Munugode Assembly constituency during a vehicle check on Wednesday. According to the police, the cash was found in a Maruti Brezza car on its way to the poll-bound Munugode. The car was reportedly owned by Congress politician C Rama Krishna Reddy.

186.title: Indian Defence sector will be a world leader in coming times: Rajnath
186.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Tuesday said that Indian Defence sector will be a world leader in the coming times. Speaking at 'Manthan' ceremony in Gujarat, Singh said, "India is the youngest country in the world today, not only from a demographic point of view, but also from the mind." "Its thinking is new, its goals are new," he added.

187.title: ﻿Droom withdraws its initial public offering
187.article_body: A recent notification from the market regulator SEBI shows that automobile e-commerce company ﻿Droom has withdrawn its initial public offering. Droom had filed a draft red herring prospectus with SEBI to raise up to ₹3,000 crore. The proposed IPO included fresh issue of shares aggregating ₹2,000 crore and an offer for sale of shares aggregating ₹1,000 crore by Droom Pte.

188.title: Senior Chinese diplomat attacked Hong Kong protester, says UK MP; China responds
188.article_body: Senior Chinese diplomat Zheng Xiyuan was involved in attacking a Hong Kong pro-democracy protester outside the consulate in Manchester, a British MP alleged. The protester was allegedly pulled by the hair, dragged inside the consulate and beaten by the staff. China has responded to the allegations, saying the protesters 'illegally entered' the consulate and 'violated its peace and dignity'.

189.title: Stain on Modi govt's legacy: Cong on release of Bilkis case convicts
189.article_body: Congress on Tuesday accused the PM Narendra Modi-led central government of granting release to convicts in the Bilkis Bano case for political motives, adding that the stain on the government's legacy won't wash off. "It is repugnant, reprehensible and revolting that an elected government chose to release these convicts in such a cavalier manner," said Congress spokesperson Abhishek Singhvi.

190.title: Over 30,000 near-Earth asteroids have been discovered so far: ESA
190.article_body: According to the European Space Agency (ESA), over 30,000 near-Earth Asteroids (NEAs) have been discovered so far. NEAs are rocky bodies orbiting the Sun on a path that brings them close to Earth's orbit. They comprise one-third of around one million asteroids discovered in the solar system. Most of these NEAs live in the asteroid belt between Jupiter and Mars.

191.title: Govt should set moderate divestment targets: DIPAM Secretary
191.article_body: Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM) Secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey said that the government should focus on privatisation of state-run companies instead of chasing high divestment targets. "We should actually have moderate targets and more focus should be on privatising," he said. Indian government has set a ₹650 billion divestment and privatisation target for 2022-23.

192.title: Adani Defence & Aerospace to acquire Air Works for ₹400 crore
192.article_body: Adani Group's wholly-owned subsidiary, Adani Defence & Aerospace, said it has signed definitive agreements to acquire Air Works for ₹400 crore. According to the statement, Air Works is India's oldest maintenance, repair and operations (MRO) organisation with six maintenance bays and over 900 maintenance experts. Indian MRO market is expected to grow three times by 2030, the company highlighted.

193.title: Pic of valid insurance policy of Ranveer Singh's ₹3.9 crore Aston Martin surfaces online
193.article_body: After a Twitter user claimed that Ranveer Singh was driving his ₹3.9 crore Aston Martin with expired insurance, it has now emerged that the car does have a valid insurance policy and the document has been shared online. The document shows the insurance was renewed as recently as this July. He was recently seen driving the vehicle at Mumbai airport.

194.title: Cyclone Sitrang likely to develop over Bay of Bengal around Oct 24
194.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Tuesday said the post-monsoon season's first cyclone is likely to develop over the Bay of Bengal around October 24. A low-pressure area is likely to develop by Thursday over southeast and adjoining east-central Bay of Bengal, the IMD added. Once it intensifies into a cyclone, it will be called 'Sitrang', as named by Thailand.

195.title: BJP wins all three seats in Zila Panchayat bypolls in Goa
195.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has won all three seats in the bypolls to Zila Panchayat constituencies in Goa, results of which were declared on Tuesday. BJP candidates Paresh Naik and Sandeep Kashinath Bandodkar won from Davorlim and Reis-Magos constituencies respectively while BJP-backed independent candidate Merciana Mendes E Vaz won from Cortalim constituency. Bandodkar won by 4,244 votes.

196.title: Mohanlal's 'Monster' banned in Gulf countries over LGBTQ content: Reports
196.article_body: Actor Mohanlal's upcoming Malayalam movie 'Monster' has reportedly been banned in the Gulf countries. As per reports, it was not cleared in the Gulf region as the censor board was not happy with the LGBTQ content in it. The makers have reportedly decided to re-submit the movie to the censor board after making necessary changes.

197.title: New Zealand's inflation stays near 32-year high at 7.2% in Q3
197.article_body: New Zealand's inflation remained near a 32-year high in the third quarter as annual inflation eased to 7.2% from 7.3% in the second quarter, Statistics New Zealand said on Tuesday. Consumer prices rose 2.2% in the last quarter. Earlier, New Zealand's Reserve Bank had predicted inflation would drop to 6.4%, while economists expected the rate to drop to 6.5%.

198.title: John Cena shares old pic of New Zealand batter Glenn Phillips on Instagram
198.article_body: Actor and WWE wrestler John Cena took to Instagram to share an old picture of New Zealand batter Glenn Phillips celebrating his T20I hundred against West Indies in 2020. His post comes amid T20 World Cup 2022 being held in Australia. Reacting to the picture, a fan wrote, "So...John Cena is the third umpire?" Another wrote, "Do you watch cricket?"

199.title: Education isn't business: Varun Gandhi on UP student crying over fees
199.article_body: BJP's Varun Gandhi on Tuesday shared a video of a girl who reportedly studies at a private school in UP's Unnao, crying as she was disallowed from taking an exam over non-payment of fees. "Private institutions, don't forget humanity. Education is not a business," Gandhi said, adding that the tears of the girl show the pain of lakhs of children.

200.title: Indians can see who allowed rapists to walk free: Moitra on Bilkis case
200.article_body: Reacting to the release of Bilkis Bano's rape convicts, TMC MP Mahua Moitra said, "Indians can see for the first time...who allowed rapists and killers to walk free prematurely." This comes after the Gujarat government disclosed that the central government had approved the release of the convicts. Moitra tweeted, "The CBI said NO...And yet Centre said YES to...'premature release' of...convicts."

201.title: Deeply saddened: Sunny Deol on Kedarnath helicopter crash
201.article_body: After a helicopter carrying Kedarnath pilgrims crashed in Uttarakhand, Sunny Deol tweeted, "Deeply saddened to hear about the Kedarnath helicopter tragedy. My heart goes out to the families of the pilgrims and the pilot. Om Shanti." Meanwhile, Sanjay Dutt wrote, "Sending my deepest condolences to the families of the people who lost their lives in the helicopter crash today."

202.title: Quoted judgments, facts missing: SC on Guj govt's reply in Bilkis Bano rape convicts' release
202.article_body: Supreme Court on Tuesday said Gujarat government's reply to pleas challenging release of 11 convicts in Bilkis Bano rape case has quoted a series of judgments but factual statements are missing. "A very bulky counter. Where is the factual statement, where is the application of mind?" the SC said. Pleas challenging convicts' release will next be heard on November 29.

203.title: IFS officer shares pic of a rare clouded leopard, says 'See the amazing patterns'
203.article_body: Indian Forest Service (IFS) officer Parveen Kaswan recently took to Twitter to share a picture of a clouded leopard, which he said was "one of the rare big cat species found in India". "Clouded leopards are beautiful creatures. See the amazing patterns," he tweeted. He also said that the species is very less studied and understood.

204.title: WI have what it takes to turn it around: Holder ahead of Zimbabwe game
204.article_body: Ahead of West Indies' Group B match against Zimbabwe in T20 World Cup 2022, West Indies all-rounder Jason Holder said his side has what it takes to turn it around following their "disappointing" performance against Scotland. "We obviously didn't bat well yesterday," he added. West Indies lost the match by 42 runs. They will face Zimbabwe on Wednesday.

205.title: About ₹95,000 cr to be invested in aviation sector in 4 yrs: Scindia
205.article_body: Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia has said the government and the private sector will make investments worth about ₹95,000 crore in India's civil aviation sector in next four years. The investments will reportedly be on development of greenfield and brownfield airports. This sector has passed through difficult times and it's now ready for take-off to its true potential, he added.

206.title: Amit Shah should resign: Siddaramaiah on release of Bilkis Bano case convicts
206.article_body: Congress leader Siddaramaiah demanded the resignation of Union Home Minister Amit Shah, saying his office ordered the release of convicts in the Bilkis Bano case. "The release of those inhuman rapists and murderers is to polarise electorate ahead of Gujarat elections," Siddaramaiah tweeted. "For BJP, elections become more important than the concerns of women of this country," he added.

207.title: J&K LG condemns killing of 2 UP labourers in grenade attack
207.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha on Tuesday denounced the killing of two labourers from Uttar Pradesh in a grenade attack by terrorists in Shopian. "Words cannot adequately condemn the barbaric terror attack on Manish Kumar and Ram Sagar from Kannauj, Uttar Pradesh," LG's office said in a statement. "We've intensified...efforts to crush terrorists and terror ecosystem," it stated.

208.title: Ethiopian army captures 3 towns from rebel forces in Tigray region
208.article_body: Ethiopia's national army has seized control of three towns from regional forces in the rebel-held Tigray province, the federal government said on Tuesday. "The (army) has taken control of...Shire, Alamata, and Korem....," the government stated. The Tigray conflict is a result of rivalries between regional power blocs and disagreement over power sharing between federal and regional authorities.

209.title: Pakistani drone shot by BSF at Punjab border; 3rd incident in 4 days
209.article_body: A Pakistani drone, found to be ferrying 2.5 kgs of narcotics, was shot down by the Border Security Force (BSF) along the International Border in Punjab's Amritsar, an official said on Tuesday. "A bullet hit the drone, due to which it fell to the ground," a BSF spokesperson said. This is the third such incident in the past four days.

210.title: Extremely sad: UP CM condoles loss of lives in Kedarnath helicopter crash
210.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath condoled the loss of lives in a helicopter crash near Uttarakhand's Kedarnath Dham on Tuesday, calling the incident "extremely sad". "May Prabhu Shri Ram grant a place to the departed souls at his feet. My condolences are with the bereaved families," he said. Seven people, including the pilot, were killed in the accident, officials said.

211.title: Nothing has materialised on acquisition of dr Gerard as yet: Parle
211.article_body: Biscuit maker Parle Products' Senior Category Head B Krishna Rao on Tuesday said though there was discussion some time back regarding acquisition of Polish biscuit and cookies firm dr Gerard, "nothing has materialised as yet". Reports had earlier claimed that Parle is in talks with private equity firm Bridgepoint for dr Gerard's acquisition. Bridgepoint had bought dr Gerard in 2013.

212.title: 1 child/minute being admitted for malnutrition treatment in Somalia: UNICEF
212.article_body: One child is being admitted to a health facility for the treatment of "severe acute malnutrition" every minute in Somalia, a UNICEF spokesperson said on Tuesday. This comes as Somalia faces a drought that threatens to cause the deaths of children on a scale that the UNICEF official said has not been witnessed "in half a century".

213.title: PM should undergo lie detector test & say CBI, ED independent: AAP
213.article_body: BJP should ask PM Narendra Modi to undergo a lie detector test and say the CBI and the ED are independent and have nothing to do with the party, AAP said on Tuesday. The comments came after BJP's Kapil Mishra asked Manish Sisodia to take a lie detector test over his claim that the CBI asked him to quit AAP.

214.title: Delhi Police seize over 2,000 kg firecrackers; 6 arrested
214.article_body: Delhi Police arrested six people in four separate operations and seized over 2,000 kg of firecrackers. The accused were identified as Kapil (27), Shanky (33), Suresh (59), Rakesh (40), Sagar (27) and Sanjay (53). Notably, three operations were carried out by police teams of Dwarka, North East and South Delhi districts, and one other was conducted by the narcotics squad.

215.title: Mumbai-based hotelier's family gets daughter-in-law booked for theft
215.article_body: A Mumbai-based hotelier's family has accused their daughter-in-law of stealing jewellery worth ₹18 lakh from her marital home. The mother-in-law of the woman approached the Bandra Metropolitan Magistrate court after which a case was registered. Incidentally, the accused had filed a complaint with the Khar Police in 2021 in which she had accused her husband of sexual abuse and harassment.

216.title: Haryana govt to open 40 urban health centres in Gurugram
216.article_body: The Haryana government will soon open 40 urban health centres in Gurugram city, said Gurugram Deputy Commissioner Nishant Kumar Yadav. The new wellness centres will ease the burden on the existing medical facilities, he said. "Each centre will have facilities to carry out 14 types of tests and offer 12 types of medical services to patients," he said.

217.title: Unsure if potholes resulted in B'luru woman being run over: BBMP
217.article_body: The BBMP reportedly said it has not yet been determined whether potholes led to the death of the Bengaluru woman who fell from her scooter and was mowed down by a bus. "It won't be possible to determine...the cause...until reports from the...police teams are in," said Chief Commissioner Tushar Giri Nath. The traffic police said they'll file a report soon.

218.title: 5 teens drown in river during picnic in MP; CM announces ex-gratia
218.article_body: Five boys, aged between 13 and 15, drowned in a river during a picnic on Monday in Madhya Pradesh's Katni district, police said on Tuesday. "[My] heart is filled with immense pain due to the untimely demise of innocent children," CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan tweeted. Katni Collector said the deceased's families will each receive an ex-gratia payment of ₹4 lakh.

219.title: Delhi recorded 314 new dengue cases in the past week
219.article_body: Delhi registered 314 dengue cases in the past week, which is seven cases fewer than last week's tally. In the week before, 321 dengue cases were reported. According to the Municipal Corporation Department, 635 dengue cases were reported this month till October 12. In total, 1,572 cases have been reported this year in the city so far.

220.title: T-Series head Bhushan Kumar gifts director Om Raut Ferrari supercar worth ₹4.02 crore
220.article_body: T-Series head Bhushan Kumar, who is bankrolling the upcoming epic drama 'Adipurush', has gifted the film's director Om Raut a supercar. According to reports, Kumar has gifted Raut the Ferrari F8 Tributo, which is priced at ₹4.02 crore. Reports also suggest that the car is not straight out of the showroom, but instead, it was earlier registered in Kumar's name.

221.title: How do the T20 World Cup 2022 points tables read?
221.article_body: After Day 3 of T20 World Cup 2022, Netherlands are on top of the first round Group A table, with two wins. Meanwhile, Namibia are second and Sri Lanka are third with a win each. Scotland and Zimbabwe lead Group B table, followed by Ireland and West Indies. Top two teams from each group will advance to Super 12 stage.

222.title: Delhi man cheats people of ₹8 cr via fake franchise deals, arrested
222.article_body: Delhi Police's Economic Offences Wing has arrested a man for allegedly cheating people of ₹8 crore on the pretext of making them associates in a cargo business, officials said on Tuesday. The accused presented himself as the Executive Director of Bhagwati Airways Express Ltd. and signed franchise agreements with the complainants to make them business associates, police said.

223.title: Meta accepts UK's order to sell Giphy
223.article_body: Facebook parent Meta has agreed to sell the GIF creation platform, Giphy, two years after acquiring it in a reported $400 million deal. This comes after the UK's Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) ordered Meta to sell Giphy on Tuesday after its view that the acquisition reduced innovation in the advertising market. "We are disappointed by the decision," Meta said.

224.title: 77,000 consumers face power outage due to heavy rains in Pune
224.article_body: At least 77,000 consumers faced power outages as supply to several housing societies in Pune was disrupted because of heavy rains on Monday evening, officials said. Technical staff and engineers of the Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited worked throughout night and day to restore phase-wise supply. In some areas, the supply was restored by morning, a spokesperson said.

225.title: 2017 champion Kidambi Srikanth enters pre-quarterfinal of Denmark Open
225.article_body: Former champion Kidambi Srikanth entered the pre-quarterfinal of Denmark Open on Tuesday. The Indian shuttler defeated world number 14 Ng Ka Long Angus 17-21, 21-14, 21-12 in the first round. World number 11 Srikanth, who won the tournament in 2017, will now face Loh Kean Yew. The seventh seed beat Thailand's Sitthikom Thammasin 21-13, 22-20.

226.title: Japan to impose additional sanctions against North Korea
226.article_body: Japan will impose additional sanctions on North Korea by freezing the assets of groups involved in its missile development programme, a Japanese official said on Tuesday. He stated, "We cannot tolerate North Korea's repeated provocative actions...." This comes following a string of recent ballistic missile tests carried out by Pyongyang, including the one where a projectile was fired over Japan.

227.title: Kriti Sanon shares her first look from horror-comedy film 'Bhediya'
227.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon on Tuesday unveiled her first look from the upcoming horror-comedy film 'Bhediya'. "Meet Dr. Anika! Bhediya ki doctor!" she wrote while sharing the look on her Instagram handle. Praising her look, Ayushmann Khurrana wrote in the comments section, "Too cool!" Directed by Amar Kaushik, 'Bhediya' also stars Varun Dhawan.

228.title: Mumbai to have AC local train with fibre-reinforced polymer seats by Oct end
228.article_body: Western Railway's Mumbai Division is all set to have the newly inducted air-conditioned (AC) local train with modular fibre-reinforced polymer (FRP) seats by the end of October. It comprises four types of coaches with a combined carrying capacity of 1,118 passengers. It'll also have one coach equipped with flexi-solar panels that will power the fans and lights of the coach.

229.title: 5 people arrested for murder of priest, his son in Hyderabad's Uppal
229.article_body: Five people have been arrested for their alleged involvement in the murder of a 75-year-old priest named Narsimha and his 45-year-old son in Hyderabad's Uppal on Friday. Police said the main accused, Likki Vinay Yogendar Reddy, suspected Narsimha of performing black magic on him to avoid repaying him ₹6 lakh. Reddy had given Narsimha ₹6 lakh for performing a puja.

230.title: Rhea Chakraborty danced with inmates on her last day in jail: Sudha Bharadwaj
230.article_body: Activist Sudha Bharadwaj revealed that actress Rhea Chakraborty, who was arrested in a drugs case related to Sushant Singh Rajput's death, danced with inmates on her last day in jail. "When she left, she'd some money remaining in her account, so for all...barracks she asked for sweets to be given,"  added Sudha, who was lodged in the same jail.

231.title: Delhi Transport Dept denies vehicle to disabled girl, DCW sends notice
231.article_body: The Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) has issued a notice to the city government's Transport Department, over the alleged refusal by a dealer to sell a commercial vehicle to a specially-abled girl for personal use. The girl has requested approval for her to purchase the vehicle, which is spacious enough to accommodate her motorised wheelchair, as there's no alternative available.

232.title: Done as per law: Pralhad Joshi on release of Bilkis Bano rape convicts
232.article_body: Reacting to the release of 11 men convicted in the Bilkis Bano gangrape case, Union Parliamentary Affairs Minister Pralhad Joshi said, "I do not find anything wrong in that because it is done as per the process of law." His remarks came after the Gujarat government told the Supreme Court that the convicts were released on grounds of "good behaviour".

233.title: Never nice to be on losing side: Erasmus after Namibia's loss vs Netherlands
233.article_body: Following Namibia's five-wicket loss against Netherlands in T20 World Cup 2022 Group A match, Namibia skipper Gerhard Erasmus said, "Never nice to be on...losing side when it's so close." He added, "We put a good show in the field. With...bat, it seemed difficult for both sides but they ran better than us." Netherlands chased the 122-run target in 19.3 overs.

234.title: There can be no safe havens for terrorists, drug cartels: PM Modi
234.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said there can be no safe havens for the corrupt, terrorists, drug cartels, poaching gangs and organised crime. He said, "When the threats are global, the response cannot be just local." He said a safe and secure world is "our shared responsibility", adding, "When the forces of good cooperate, the forces of crime can't operate."

235.title: Lulu Group to invest ₹3,000 crore to build India’s biggest mall at Ahmedabad
235.article_body: Lulu Group Director of Marketing and Communications V Nandakumar said it was planning to invest  ₹3,000 crore to set up India’s biggest shopping mall at Ahmedabad. He said the construction of the mall will begin early next year. The mall, which would have all modern facilities, would give direct and indirect employment to 6,000 and 12,000 people, respectively.

236.title: 3-yr-old washed away after falling into uncovered drain in Bengaluru
236.article_body: A three-year-old boy from Bengaluru's Varthur area has been reportedly washed away after he fell into an uncovered stormwater drain 100 metres from his home. The boy was playing with five other children when he fell inside. About 25 emergency services members are working to find the boy but heavy run-off from the recent rains is hampering rescue operations.

237.title: No merit in Umar Khalid's bail plea, it's dismissed: Delhi HC
237.article_body: The Delhi High Court denied bail to former JNU student Umar Khalid in the case related to an alleged conspiracy behind the Northeast Delhi riots in February 2020. "There is no merit in the bail appeal. Bail appeal is dismissed," said the bench. Khalid, who was arrested in September 2020, sought bail stating he had no role in the violence.

238.title: 'Powerful explosions' damaged Nord Stream gas pipelines: Denmark
238.article_body: Danish authorities on Tuesday confirmed that the Nord Stream 1 and 2 gas pipelines in the Baltic Sea have suffered "extensive damage", saying it was caused by "powerful explosions". Earlier this month, Sweden said its probe into the ruptures detected on the pipelines has "strengthened the suspicions of serious sabotage". Four leaks have been detected on the pipelines so far.

239.title: Anguished: PM after 7 people killed in Kedarnath helicopter crash
239.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said he is anguished by the helicopter crash in Uttarakhand. "In this tragic hour, my thoughts are with the bereaved families," PM Modi added. Seven people, including two pilots, were killed after a helicopter carrying Kedarnath pilgrims from Uttarakhand's Phata crashed on Tuesday. Meanwhile, Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Dhami has ordered an investigation into the incident.

240.title: Railways, road corporation seek nod to fell 1,000 trees in B'luru
240.article_body: The forest cell of the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) received two proposals from the South Western Railway (SWR) and Karnataka Road Development Corporation Limited (KRDCL) on October 17, seeking permission to fell nearly 1,000 trees. Citizens have been requested to file their objections regarding the projects for which the trees are proposed to be felled by October 27.

241.title: BEST to run extra buses in Mumbai, Suburbs & Navi Mumbai for Diwali
241.article_body: On the occasion of Diwali, BEST will run extra buses on prominent routes in Mumbai, Suburbs and Navi Mumbai between October 22 and October 26. The additional bus services will cover routes, including Dadar Plaza, Kalbadevi, Bandra, Mahatma Jyotiba Phule Market in Mumbai and APMC Market in Navi Mumbai. Moreover, 140 extra buses will run on Bhai Dooj (October 26).

242.title: Bride seeks groom from only specific 'Tier-1' colleges; matrimony ad goes viral
242.article_body: A matrimony advertisement went viral after a bride sought a groom from only specific colleges that she ranked as 'Tier-1', adding that he must be earning at least ₹30 LPA. Several Twitter users reacted to the ad, with one saying, "They're being honest...They have the right to do so." Another user tweeted, "I thought it was a job posting."

243.title: PM to virtually attend 'grih pravesh' of 4.5 lakh PMAY beneficiaries in MP
243.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will virtually participate in 'grih pravesh' of 4.50 lakh beneficiaries of Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY) on Dhanteras (October 22) in Madhya Pradesh, CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said. The main event will be held at BTI Ground, Satna. An official said 51,000 masons were trained for the construction of PMAY houses. 'Grih pravesh' is a house-warming ceremony.

244.title: Introduce 'Amar Chitra Katha' for entrepreneurship in school: Hurun India MD
244.article_body: Hurun India Founder and MD Anas Rahman Junaid said comic-like books around entrepreneurship and business must be introduced at school level in India to create children's interest in the subject at an early age. "It'll be interesting if someone can put together...something like an Amar Chitra Katha. That should do wonders," Junaid said. "Creating wealth is an art," he added.

245.title: Locals protest as stray dog mauls 7-month-old boy to death in Noida
245.article_body: Several people protested outside a housing society in Noida after a seven-month-old boy was mauled to death by a stray dog. The baby was reportedly admitted to ICU after his intestines were pulled out in the attack, however, he couldn't be saved. Meanwhile, a senior Noida Authority official said, "We're coordinating with...societies and dog shelters to check...menace of dog bites."

246.title: Man stabs estranged wife 13 times, hospitalised after suicide bid in B'luru
246.article_body: A 30-year-old man reportedly killed his 25-year-old estranged wife by stabbing her 13 times in Bengaluru. He later tried to take his own life and was hospitalised with injuries to his stomach and throat. The accused reportedly suspected his wife of having an affair. They married seven years ago and had been living separately for two years.

247.title: Disturbing elements illegally entered the Manchester consulate: China
247.article_body: After a pro-democracy Hong Kong protester was allegedly assaulted inside the Chinese consulate in Manchester, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Wang Wenbin said that "disturbing elements" had illegally entered the consulate. Wang Wenbin declined to confirm or deny whether China's Consul General in Manchester was involved in the incident. British police launched an investigation into the case.

248.title: Man beats brother to death with frying pan in Ghaziabad; arrested
248.article_body: A man allegedly beat his brother to death with a frying pan on Sunday in Ghaziabad. Both the brothers, who have been identified as Bablu Kumar and Arjun Kumar, were reportedly drunk at the time of the incident. An argument reportedly broke out between them when Bablu was beating his wife over suspicion of having an extra-marital affair with Arjun.

249.title: It's now about winning 3rd game: Edwards on Netherlands' win vs Namibia
249.article_body: After Netherlands won their second consecutive Group A match in T20 World Cup 2022 against Namibia, Netherlands skipper Scott Edwards said that it's now about winning the third match to secure Super 12 qualification for his side. Netherlands defeated Namibia by five wickets. With four points from two matches, Netherlands are currently at the top of Group A standings.

250.title: Windows failed to protect users against malicious drivers: Report
250.article_body: Microsoft failed to protect millions of Windows users against malicious drivers as it didn't update the list of affected drivers in nearly three years, according to a report by Ars Technica. Exploiting the vulnerability, cybercriminals can take control of users' devices using a technique called 'BYOVD'. "Microsoft is...aware of BYOVD threat and has been working on defences," the report said.

251.title: Constable asks MP man to remove tinted glass from SUV windows, beaten
251.article_body: A man allegedly thrashed a traffic constable in Madhya Pradesh's Indore when the latter asked him to remove tinted glass from his car windows and pay a fine for violating rules on Monday. The 31-year-old SUV owner then hit his own head with a stone when he saw other police personnel approaching him, police said. The accused was arrested.

252.title: Byju’s standalone business posted loss in FY21 with 30% revenue drop
252.article_body: Edtech startup Byju's standalone business, comprising K-12 (kindergarten to class 12) offerings, posted a loss of ₹2,702.14 crore for FY21 against a profit of ₹7.39 crore in FY20 with revenues falling over 30% during the year, the company's recent filings with the Ministry of Corporate Affairs showed. Revenue from operations fell to ₹1,378.51 crore from ₹1,918.25 crore a year earlier.

253.title: Thane man seeking refund of ₹299 loses ₹49,000 to cyber fraud
253.article_body: A 54-year-old Kalyan resident seeking a refund of ₹299 for a failed mobile phone recharge was allegedly cheated of ₹49,950 in a cyber fraud. The victim received a call from a fraudster who offered to help him and sent a phishing link and induced him to share his bank account details and siphoned money from his account, police said.

254.title: UAE record lowest total of T20 World Cup 2022
254.article_body: UAE on Tuesday were dismissed for 73 runs in 17.1 overs by Sri Lanka in their T20 World Cup 2022 Round 1 match. It's the lowest total in T20 World Cup 2022. UAE's Aayan Afzal Khan, the youngest cricketer to feature in T20 World Cup aged 16, top-scored with 19(21). Meanwhile, eight of 11 UAE batters scored in single digits.

255.title: Tamil Nadu Assembly adopts resolution against imposition of Hindi
255.article_body: The Tamil Nadu government moved a resolution against Hindi imposition in the state Assembly. "This House expresses concern that the recommendations of the Parliamentary Committee...are against the two-language policy resolution moved and passed by Perarignar Anna...This House urges the Union government not to implement the recommendations made in the report," said the resolution.

256.title: Cong has again proved internal democracy: CEA on party's chief poll
256.article_body: Congress Central Election Authority (CEA) Chairman Madhusudan Mistry on Monday said the party has "once again proved what internal democracy is and other parties can take lessons from it". His statement came while addressing a press conference after the conclusion of voting for the Congress Presidential election. "By and large, 96% voting took place across states," Mistry stated.

257.title: Corruption-free administration needed for sustainable development: Kerala CM
257.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Tuesday said a corruption-free administrative system is necessary for sustainable development of a country and it is with this view the state government is functioning. "That's why Kerala has the honour of being the state with the least corruption in India," Vijayan said. In future, we would be able to eradicate it completely, Vijayan added.

258.title: India's Nutakki expelled from World Junior Chess C'ship for having earbuds in pocket
258.article_body: Indian Woman Grandmaster (WGM) Priyanka Nutakki has been expelled from World Junior Chess Championship being held in Italy for having earbuds in her jacket pocket. Saying that there is no indication of foul play on her part, FIDE stated that earbuds are "strictly forbidden" in playing hall. The point scored by Nutakki in sixth round was awarded to her opponent.

259.title: UAE's Junaid Siddique smashes biggest six of T20 World Cup 2022
259.article_body: UAE's number 10 batter Junaid Siddique smashed a 109-metre maximum on the bowling of Sri Lanka fast bowler Dushmantha Chameera during their T20 World Cup 2022 Round 1 match on Tuesday. It is the biggest six of T20 World Cup 2022. Notably, it was the only six of UAE's innings against Sri Lanka.

260.title: Harrison Ford joins MCU, to play 'Thunderbolt' Ross in Captain America 4
260.article_body: Veteran American actor Harrison Ford has joined the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) and will be seen in 'Captain America: New World Order', the fourth instalment in the 'Captain America' franchise. Harrison has replaced William Hurt to portray Thaddeus 'Thunderbolt' Ross. William passed away in March this year. The film is expected to release in 2024.

261.title: Indonesia to demolish football stadium where stampede killed 133
261.article_body: Indonesian President Joko Widodo has said that the football stadium where a stampede killed 133 people will be torn down and rebuilt according to FIFA standards. The new stadium will have "proper facilities that can ensure the safety of...players and supporters", he added. The stampede on October 1 happened after police tear-gassed fans who invaded the pitch after a defeat.

262.title: Amit Shah expresses grief over loss of lives in Kedarnath helicopter crash
262.article_body: After a helicopter carrying Kedarnath pilgrims crashed in Uttarakhand, Union Home Minister Amit Shah expressed grief over the incident. "The incident of the crash…is very saddening," Shah tweeted. "I express my condolences to the families of all those who lost their lives in this accident. May God give them the strength to bear this grief," Shah added.

263.title: Man files complaint about bad road, meets with accident on same road in B'luru
263.article_body: On October 6, a 66-year-old man moved a complaint to BBMP, stating the road from BEL Circle to Peenya Metro Station was in a bad condition. On Wednesday, he met with an accident on the same road while trying to avoid a pothole. Following the accident, the BBMP chief said redevelopment work of the stretch would be taken up soon.

264.title: 23 children killed in mass protests in Iran: UN rights office
264.article_body: At least 23 children have been killed in the protests in Iran, a UN human rights office spokesperson said. Children have been killed due to live ammunition, metal pellets at close range and fatal beatings. An unspecified number of children had been arrested during school raids, the rights office added. Protests were triggered after the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini.

265.title: Boman didn't have dates, I convinced him to do 'Uunchai': Anupam
265.article_body: Anupam Kher revealed that he had to convince Boman Irani to do 'Uunchai'. "When I asked Sooraj (Barjatya, director) about the cast, he said there's a nice role for Boman, but he doesn't have dates and has some personal commitments...So I called him later and convinced him to do the film," he said. The film will release on November 11.

266.title: Be responsible and choose appropriate words: Delhi court to Tejashwi
266.article_body: A Delhi court suggested Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav to be responsible and choose appropriate words while speaking in public. "You have to understand the implications of your words. This should not happen again," said the court. The court also refused to cancel the bail granted to him in the alleged Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) scam case.

267.title: Delhi to get 100 electric vehicle charging stations in 2 months: CM
267.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said the city would get 100 electric vehicle charging stations in the next two months. Kejriwal inaugurated 11 charging stations on Tuesday and said the facilities would also include battery swapping points. These 11 stations have 73 charging points, he added. The Delhi Electric Vehicles policy was introduced in 2020.

268.title: Mumbai Police return lost bag to owner with ₹2 lakh cash in 2 hours
268.article_body: Mumbai Police on Sunday traced and returned a bag with ₹2 lakh cash within two hours after the owner forgot the bag in an auto-rickshaw. According to police, the complainant and his brother boarded an auto from outside Borivali East railway station to purchase a second-hand taxi. "In a hurry...they forgot the bag with cash in the auto," police added.

269.title: 2 Naxalites surrender before security forces in Chhattisgarh's Sukma
269.article_body: Two Naxalites surrendered before the security forces in Chhattisgarh's Sukma district, police said on Tuesday. The surrendered Naxalites, identified as Ganga and Deva, were residents of Gadiras area and were a part of the Dandakaranya Adivasi Kisan Majdoor Sangthan (DAKMS), an official said. Ganga was carrying a reward of ₹1 lakh on his head, the official added.

270.title: Indian Railways to run 211 special trains amid festive season
270.article_body: The Indian Railways has announced 211 special trains across country amid festive season, the Railways announced on Tuesday. The trains will cover a total of 2,561 trips till Chhath Puja this year, the railways added. The trains will connect major destinations throughout the country such as Darbhanga, Azamgarh, Saharsa, Bhagalpur, Muzaffarpur, Firozpur, Patna, Katihar, and Amritsar, among others.

271.title: Pak official doesn't reply when asked 'will you handover Dawood to India?'; video out
271.article_body: Pakistan's chief of the Federal Investigation Agency (FIA) Mohsin Butt was on Tuesday asked by a reporter, "Will this process of extradition with India move forward? Will you handover Dawood Ibrahim to India?" A video of Butt's reaction showed him looking away from the reporter and refusing to answer his question. The video was taken during Interpol conference in Delhi.

272.title: Annexed Ukrainian regions protected by nuclear weapons: Russia
272.article_body: Russia on Tuesday said that the four Ukrainian regions annexed last month are under the protection of its nuclear arsenal. "All these territories [Donetsk, Luhansk, Kherson and Zaporizhzhia] are inalienable parts of Russia," Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said. Russian President Vladimir Putin has warned that Russia will use nuclear weapons if its "territorial integrity" is threatened.

273.title: Tech Mahindra signs MoU with Guj; to hire 3,000 employees in 5 yrs
273.article_body: Tech Mahindra has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Gujarat government under the latter's Employment Generation Incentive and the 'Aatmanirbhar Gujarat Sahay Yojana'. The IT giant plans to hire over 3,000 professionals in Gujarat over the next five years. Tech Mahindra's MoU is one among the 15 MoUs signed by Gujarat government with domestic and global IT companies.

274.title: No comparison with Lord Ram: Patole on Minister’s remark on Rahul
274.article_body: Responding to Rajasthan Minister Parsadi Lal Meena's comment, which likened Rahul Gandhi to Lord Ram, Congress' Nana Patole said that it's a coincidence that Rahul Gandhi and Lord Ram have an 'R' in their name. Rahul is covering even more distance than Lord Ram by walking from Kanniyakumari to Kashmir, Meena had earlier said.

275.title: Ambuja Cement raises ₹5,000 crore through Adani's family firm
275.article_body: Ambuja Cement on Tuesday said it has issued 47.74 crore warrants at a price band of ₹418.87 to Adani family firm Harmonia Trade and Investment and raised ₹5,000 crore. The warrants, issued on preferential basis to Harmonia, have a face value of ₹2. Harmonia Trade and Investment has until now paid ₹104.72/warrant, which is around 25% of the issue price.

276.title: AAP to build schools at every 4 km in 8 Guj cities if voted to power: Sisodia
276.article_body: If AAP is voted to power in Gujarat, it will build a government school at every four kilometres in eight cities within a year, Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia said on Tuesday. "The people of Gujarat are determined to get schools made for their children and will elect a party that builds schools," Sisodia added.

277.title: 12 She mobile electric toilets rolled out in 6 GHMC zones
277.article_body: As part of the central government's Safe City initiative, 12 She mobile electric toilets have been rolled out for women in six Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) zones. The restrooms are available in Secunderabad, LB Nagar, Khairatabad, Charminar, Serilingampally and Kukatpally. In Hyderabad Commissionerate, facilities will be stationed at places like Dharna Chowk and Pragathi Bhavan.

278.title: Mini-bus rams into autorickshaw on way to school in Thane, 3 hurt
278.article_body: Three children travelling in an autorickshaw to school sustained injuries when a mini-bus crashed into their vehicle and dragged it for some distance in Thane. The injured children, class 2 students, were taken to a hospital for treatment. The autorickshaw driver said he jammed the brakes of the autorickshaw and ensured that the children didn't sustain any major injury.

279.title: Russia denies using Iranian drones in attack on Ukraine
279.article_body: The Kremlin on Tuesday denied that its forces had used Iranian drones to attack Ukraine, saying that Russian equipment with Russian nomenclature was used. Ukraine accused Russia of using Iranian Shahed-136 "kamikaze" drones, which explode on impact, to carry out attacks in Kyiv. Iran has denied supplying drones to Russia, however, the US State Department accused Iran of lying.

280.title: 'Scam 1992' fame Pratik Gandhi buys Mercedes car worth ₹1.16 crore, pics surface
280.article_body: Actor Pratik Gandhi, who played the role of Harshad Mehta in 'Scam 1992', bought a Mercedes-Benz GLS 450 which is worth around ₹1.16 crore. As per reports, the actor purchased the car on the occasion of Dussehra. Pratik was recently seen in 'Kahani Rubberband Ki', which was released on October 14.

281.title: Singer Chinmayi shares pic of her baby bump, rubbishes surrogacy rumours
281.article_body: Singer Chinmayi Sripaada, who welcomed twins in June, took to Instagram to share a picture of her baby bump. "The only selfie I took throughout pregnancy. The only. Here at almost 32 weeks," she captioned the picture. In a video, the 38-year-old rubbished rumours about her babies born via surrogacy and revealed that she had her twins after a miscarriage.

282.title: Suspect uploads morphed video of Gurugram girl on Insta reels; case filed
282.article_body: An unidentified person was booked for allegedly uploading a morphed video of a Gurugram-based girl on social media. The suspect made an Instagram reel in which a minor's face was added to a pornographic video and then the video link was sent to her father, the police said. The act seemed to be an attempt to defame her, police added.

283.title: Tata Communications' Q2 net profit rises by 25% to ₹532 crore
283.article_body: Tata Communications on Tuesday reported a 25.1% surge in its consolidated net profit for the September quarter at ₹532 crore from ₹425 crore in the corresponding quarter last year. Its revenue from operations was ₹4,431 crore, a 6.2% increase as against ₹4,174 crore in the same quarter last year. Data business revenues were at ₹3,493 crore, a 4.6% increase quarter-on-quarter.

284.title: Ather Energy raises ₹400.6 crore in Caladium Investment-led round
284.article_body: Electric vehicle maker Ather Energy has secured ₹400.6 crore in a funding round led by Caladium Investment which invested ₹400 crore, according to Registrar of Companies' filings. The funding round also saw participation from Herald Square Ventures which pumped in ₹64 lakh. In May 2022, the startup had raised around ₹991 crore in a Series E funding round.

285.title: UP principal locks girl in room, chops her hair for coming to school with 1 braid
285.article_body: A school principal in Uttar Pradesh's Farrukhabad was booked for allegedly locking up a girl student in a room and chopping off her hair against her will. The girl alleged that the principal had made it a rule that all the girls have to come to school with two braids. She was 'punished' as she had made only one braid.

286.title: Case filed over morphed video of minor in Gurugram
286.article_body: Gurugram Police booked an unidentified suspect for allegedly uploading a morphed video of a girl on social media. The accused made an Instagram reel in which the minor's face was added to a pornographic video and then the video was sent to her father, police said. The FIR was lodged under section 67A of the Information Technology Act.

287.title: Akshay set himself on fire in 'Waqt...', I asked 'What're you doing?': Big B
287.article_body: Talking about Akshay Kumar during an episode of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 14', actor Amitabh Bachchan said, "Akshay jumps from one building to another. In 'Waqt: The Race Against Time', he set himself on fire." "I keep asking him, 'What're you doing?', and he responds that [the stunt] will be done," added Amitabh. "Akshay does [the stunts] well also," he stated.

288.title: He's a nice man: Azharuddin on Binny's appointment as new BCCI President
288.article_body: Commenting on Roger Binny's appointment as the new BCCI President, replacing Sourav Ganguly, ex-India captain Mohammed Azharuddin said, "He (Binny) is a nice man." He added, "I have played a lot of cricket with him and we have fond memories." Former India cricketer Binny was appointed as the 36th President of BCCI on Tuesday.

289.title: Cognizant rolls out salary hikes for employees after Wipro & TCS
289.article_body: IT company Cognizant has begun rolling out annual salary hikes for its employees, reportedly ranged between 7% to 10%. This comes after Wipro, TCS and Infosys rolled out hikes recently. Last week, Cognizant told its employees that "formal eLetters" with new compensation would be out through the week and the hike would take effect for levels up to associate director.

290.title: A transforming, different experience for me: Ishaan on 'Pippa'
290.article_body: Actor Ishaan Khatter said his upcoming film 'Pippa' has certainly been "a transforming, different experience" for him. "It is in that kind of zone that is not being explored by young actors," Ishaan added. In 'Pippa', Ishaan will be seen playing Brigadier Balram Singh Mehta, who fought on the eastern front during the Indo-Pakistan War of 1971.

291.title: Liverpool are still a great team: Ex-forward Sadio Mane
291.article_body: Ex-Liverpool forward Sadio Mane has said Liverpool played with a great mindset against Manchester City to claim their third Premier League win of the season on Sunday. "It shows that they still are a great team. Liverpool will always be Liverpool," he added. Liverpool beat defending champions Manchester City 1-0 at Anfield. Mane joined Bayern Munich in June this year.

292.title: Challenge him to say he's ready for narco test: Mishra on Sisodia's CBI claim
292.article_body: After Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia said that he was asked to leave the Aam Aadmi Party inside the CBI office, BJP leader Kapil Mishra said that he challenges him to apologise by 5 pm today. "I challenge him to either apologise or face media...and say he's ready for a lie detector test and narco test," he added.

293.title: On suspicion of theft, man threatens to drop boy in well in MP
293.article_body: A case has been filed after a man held a boy in a well by the hand and threatened to drop him on the suspicion that he stole a phone in Madhya Pradesh's Chhatarpur, police said on Tuesday. A teenager, who recorded a video of the incident, informed the boy's parents. Video purportedly shows the boy dangling in the well.

294.title: President Murmu condoles loss of lives in Kedarnath helicopter crash
294.article_body: After a helicopter carrying Kedarnath pilgrims crashed in Uttarakhand, President Droupadi Murmu on Tuesday condoled the loss of lives in the incident. Seven people, including a pilot, have been killed in the incident, officials said. "My deepest condolences to the families who lost their loved ones," President Murmu tweeted. PM Narendra Modi also expressed grief over the incident.

295.title: Man sets ablaze 5 family members including 2 stepchildren in Punjab
295.article_body: As many as five members of a family, including two children, were allegedly burnt to death by their 30-year-old stepfather at a village in Punjab's Jalandhar, police said. The accused, a daily wager, mixed petrol and diesel, and sprayed on the victims before setting them ablaze, police added. Among the deceased were his wife and her parents.

296.title: 2 tourists killed, 3 injured in hot air balloon mishap in Turkey
296.article_body: A hot air balloon carrying 28 passengers and two crew members made a hard landing in Turkey's Cappadocia on Tuesday, killing two Spanish tourists and injuring three others from Spain, the local governor's office said. An unexpected increase in wind speed has been identified as the cause of the accident, according to initial assessments, the governor said in a statement.

297.title: Electronics Mart India shares rise 10% after Nippon India MF buys stake
297.article_body: Electronics Mart India's stock locked in the 10% upper circuit at ₹92.95/share on NSE on Tuesday, a day after Nippon India Mutual Fund bought an additional 0.6% of its equity stake at an average price of ₹89.42 apiece. In the previous session, which was the first trading day for the stock after IPO, its shares closed at a 43% gain.

298.title: My dream is to cover distance between Delhi & Mumbai's Nariman Point in 12 hrs: Gadkari
298.article_body: Union Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari on Monday said it was his "dream" to connect Mumbai's Bandra-Worli Sea Link directly with Mumbai-Delhi Express Highway. He added, "My dream is also to connect Nariman Point (in Mumbai) with Delhi and cover the entire distance in 12 hours." The first phase of the Delhi-Mumbai expressway will be completed this year, he said.

299.title: 15-year-old boy trying to enter Gurugram society for fair assaulted by guards
299.article_body: A 15-year-old boy who had come to see a Diwali fair organised in a housing society in Sector 49 of Gurugram was allegedly abused, kicked and beaten up with sticks by the guards, police said on Monday. Police added that an FIR has been registered in the case. The boy was reportedly stopped at the gate of the society.

300.title: Stop wasting time levying fines during Diwali period: Patil to Pune Police
300.article_body: Maharashtra minister and BJP leader Chandrakant Patil on Monday told Pune Police to counsel commuters instead of imposing fines on them. "It is the Diwali period ahead and police should stop wasting their time [levying] fines...So orders are being issued to not waste time in giving challans to traffic violators in order to curtail traffic jams," Patil said.

301.title: 32-year-old Mumbai man cheated of over ₹3 lakh by cyber fraudster
301.article_body: A 32-year-old man was cheated of over ₹3 lakh by a fake recruiter online on the pretext of securing a well-paying job in Mumbai. He received a call purportedly from the HR department of a reputed airline and was induced by a woman to transfer the amount to the bank account number provided by her.

302.title: Students made to stand under sun all day for not paying school fee in UP's Unnao
302.article_body: Some students who were not able to pay school fees were made to stand under the sun all day in Uttar Pradesh. The incident took place in Bal Vidya Mandir in Unnao district. In a video that reportedly went viral, a student said she has already told her family about the fee and her father was going to pay it.

303.title: Big B is the easiest actor I've worked with: 'Uunchai' director Sooraj
303.article_body: 'Uunchai' director Sooraj Barjatya said that Amitabh Bachchan has been "the easiest actor" he's worked with. "Spending time with him off the set in the van was ever special because he would talk about poetry and filmmaking," he added. Amitabh Bachchan said it was an honour for him to work in 'Uunchai', which also features Anupam Kher and Boman Irani.

304.title: Death toll in Russian warplane crash rises to 13
304.article_body: At least 13 people, including three children, have been killed after a Russian warplane Su-34 bomber crashed into a residential area in Russian city of Yeysk after suffering engine failure. Three people died after they jumped from upper floors of a nine-storey apartment building to escape a blaze, a Russian news agency reported. Nineteen injured people have been hospitalised.

305.title: 2 of 3 siblings abducted from Rajasthan found dead in Delhi; accused arrested
305.article_body: Rajasthan Police has arrested two men accused of abducting three brothers from Rajasthan's Alwar and found the bodies of two boys, aged 13 and eight, in Delhi, a day after the accused demanded ₹8 lakh ransom. The third sibling, aged seven, has been taken to a children's home. The accused had killed the two boys after they started crying.

306.title: Quick 20 in T20 WC warm-up match vs NZ will make Pant automatic pick: Gavaskar
306.article_body: Sunil Gavaskar said Rishabh Pant will become an "automatic pick" in India's lineup for T20 World Cup if he scores a quick 20 in the warm-up match against New Zealand at the Gabba. Gavaskar added Pant will be happy to play at the Gabba, having helped India end Australia's 32-year unbeaten streak in Test cricket at the ground in 2021.

307.title: Don't think Smith will be a part of playing XI for T20 WC match vs NZ: Bailey
307.article_body: Australia's Chairman of Selectors George Bailey said he doesn't think former Australia captain Steve Smith will be a part of the playing XI for Australia's opening match of the T20 World Cup 2022 against New Zealand. "Should we need a role from Smith at some stage, then absolutely," added Bailey. Australia were recently defeated by India in a warm-up match.

308.title: Scindia urges 8 states to reduce VAT on ATF to increase air connectivity
308.article_body: Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia has urged eight states, including West Bengal, Delhi and Punjab, to reduce VAT on aviation turbine fuel (ATF) to facilitate air connectivity to tier-2 and tier-3 cities. He said that there were 12 states that had far-sighted views on the issue and they lowered VAT on ATF many months ago.

309.title: 30-year-old woman, lover kill her husband in Ludhiana; arrested
309.article_body: A 30-year-old woman, along with her lover, allegedly murdered her husband in Ludhiana's Phullanwal village. They were arrested on Monday. The accused tried to make it look like a road accident death and took the victim to a hospital. Later, they confessed to their crime. The accused attacked the victim with an iron rod, a police official said.

310.title: Nuclear threat more useful to Russia than nuclear strike: Norway
310.article_body: Norway's armed forces chief said that the West should listen carefully when Russian President Vladimir Putin talks about using nuclear weapons but should remember that it's more useful for Putin to threaten their use than to go ahead. "It's about deterrence...It's about making sure that it [Russia] has the capability...that it can do it," General Eirik Kristoffersen added.

311.title: Microsoft fires around 1,000 employees across several divisions: Report
311.article_body:
Microsoft has fired around 1,000 employees across several divisions this week, as per Axios. The job cuts affected less than 1% of Microsoft's total workforce of around 2,21,000 as of June 30.
Microsoft in a statement said,  "Like all companies, we evaluate our business priorities on a regular basis, and make structural adjustments accordingly."

312.title: Sri Lanka's Nissanka falls over and loses shoe while hitting four, video goes viral
312.article_body: Sri Lanka opener Pathum Nissanka fell over and lost his shoe while hitting a scoop shot for a boundary during his team's T20 World Cup 2022 match against UAE. Reacting to a video of the shot shared by ICC, a fan wrote, "Should be called 'shoe off shot'." Another fan joked, "That's how I enter my room."

313.title: BMW & other cars get washed away amid rain in Pune, videos surface
313.article_body: Amid heavy rainfall in Pune, people have shared videos and pictures of the rain-battered city on social media. Some videos showed cars getting washed away in rainwater, while one video showed a BMW 5 series car being held on a submerged road in Pune on Monday. As per IMD, Monday was the third wettest October day in Pune since 2011.

314.title: Maha minister orders reconstruction, repair of 400 km of Pune roads
314.article_body: Maharashtra minister Chandrakant Patil has ordered the reconstruction and repair of 400 kilometres of roads in Pune city. "The rains played havoc with the lives of citizens, resulting in bad roads and traffic jams across the city," he said. "Private traffic wardens will be stationed for traffic management, and roads under the Pune metro bridges will be repaired," Patil added.

315.title: Hair-straightening chemicals linked with uterine cancer risk: Study
315.article_body: Hair-straightening chemicals may significantly increase the risk of developing uterine cancer among those who use them frequently, according to a study by the US' National Institutes of Health. For the study, researchers tracked 33,497 racially diverse women aged between 35 and 74 for an average of nearly 11 years. During that time, 378 uterine cancer cases were diagnosed.

316.title: Hope to make cars for Tesla one day: Foxconn Chairman Liu Young-way
316.article_body: As it ramps up electric vehicle manufacturing, Foxconn says it wants to replicate its level of success in assembling consumer gadgets. Chairman Liu Young-way said, "Hope one day we can do Tesla cars for Tesla," adding, "Ambitions-wise, hopefully we're able to achieve the same kind of achievement like in ICT industry, but we'll start small...which is about 5% in 2025".

317.title: My father was a neo-Nazi, yelled 'don't be a f*****' at me: Spacey in sex abuse trial
317.article_body: Actor Kevin Spacey has denied the sex abuse claims levelled against him by actor Anthony Rapp, who alleged Spacey tried to have sex with him when he was 14. He further defended himself for coming out as gay after the abuse allegations. "My father was a white supremacist and neo-Nazi...He would scream at me: 'Don't be a f*****'," said Spacey.

318.title: UAE's 22-yr-old Meiyappan becomes 1st bowler to take a hat-trick in T20 World Cup 2022
318.article_body: UAE's 22-year-old leg-spinner Karthik Meiyappan on Tuesday became the first bowler to take a hat-trick in T20 World Cup 2022. Meiyappan dismissed Bhanuka Rajapaksa, Charith Asalanka and Dasun Shanaka in three consecutive deliveries in Sri Lanka's 15th over. Meiyappan is the fifth bowler to take a hat-trick in T20 World Cup history.

319.title: Salman wanted to do 'Uunchai', I said no: Director Sooraj Barjatya
319.article_body: Director Sooraj Barjatya said Salman Khan wanted to star in his upcoming film 'Uunchai', but he refused to cast him. "I said no because I wanted a different cast," Sooraj said. Salman and Sooraj Barjatya previously collaborated for many films, including 'Maine Pyar Kiya' and 'Hum Aapke Hain Koun'. Talking about Salman, Sooraj said the actor is his "best friend".

320.title: NIA conducts raids at 2 places in Patna in connection with PFI case
320.article_body: The NIA conducted raids at two locations in Patna's Phulwari Sharif in connection with the alleged terror module linked to the PFI. A search operation has been launched at the residence of Margub Ahmed, alias Danish. He was allegedly running a WhatsApp group called Ghazwa-e-Hind, a suspected terror organisation. Earlier, the NIA conducted raids in Darbhanga, Madhubani, among other districts.

321.title: Water taxi connecting Navi Mumbai to South Mumbai in 15 mins launched
321.article_body: Mumbai Port Trust has launched a water taxi service between Belapur to the Gateway of India and Uran that will reduce the travel time between Navi Mumbai and South Mumbai to 15 minutes. The 65-seater water taxi between Belapur and Uran, and the 200-seater taxi between Belapur and Gateway of India will charge ₹300 and ₹400 for one way, respectively.

322.title: PMC issues emergency helpline numbers amid heavy rains in Pune
322.article_body: Amid heavy rains in Pune, the municipal corporation has issued emergency helpline numbers for the residents for flood-related issues. Citizens can contact the civic authorities at 02022506800. For police, fire and ambulance services, citizens can dial 100, 101 and 108, respectively. For drinking water emergencies, citizens can contact the water supply department at 020-25501383 or 02066344203.

323.title: Won't call Shami perfect replacement of Bumrah in India's T20 WC squad: Raina
323.article_body: Speaking about Mohammad Shami replacing Jasprit Bumrah in India's squad for T20 World Cup 2022, Suresh Raina stated he wouldn't call the 32-year-old pacer a perfect replacement because Bumrah or Ravindra Jadeja cannot be replaced. "They've played consistently for India," he added. Shami took three wickets in the final over of India's six run-win over Australia in the warm-up match.

324.title: Pune hospital superintendent, peon booked for accepting bribes
324.article_body: The medical superintendent and peon of a sub-district hospital in Pune's Daund were booked for allegedly demanding and accepting bribes from a man seeking a duplicate marriage certificate as the original had got misplaced. While the medical superintendent sought a ₹3,000 bribe, the peon demanded a ₹2,000 bribe from the man, according to a press release.

325.title: Irani man tries to extort ₹40 lakh from businesswoman in Pune; arrested
325.article_body: A 31-year-old Irani national, leader of the Irani group in Pune, has been arrested for allegedly trying to extort ₹40 lakh from businesswoman Sapana Morarjee. The accused, identified as Farzad Mohamad Riza Fakhabadi, had demanded the money to withdraw a case filed by an Irani girl against Sapana's son. The girl had accused him of threatening and illegally detaining her.

326.title: Belarus to hold live-fire drills & launch anti-aircraft missiles with Russia
326.article_body: The Belarusian Defence Ministry has said that it will conduct live-fire exercises and launch anti-aircraft guided missiles as a part of joint grouping with Russian forces, a Russian news agency reported. This comes after Belarus accused Ukraine of preparing to attack its territory. Before invasion, Russia stationed its troops in Belarus before launching cross-border attacks into Ukraine.

327.title: Supreme Court lawyer collapses during hearing, judges rush to assist
327.article_body: A lawyer collapsed in the Supreme Court on Tuesday morning while arguing a case. As per a report by Bar and Bench, Justice BR Gavai and Justice BV Nagarathna rushed from their seats to assist the lawyer following the incident. A doctor was called to the court to check on the advocate, the report added.

328.title: B'luru sees wettest year in history by beating 2017 record: Report
328.article_body: With 1,704 mm of rainfall recorded in 2022, Bengaluru has broken the record for the highest annual rainfall in history, according to data from the IMD. The previous record was made in 2017, reports said. Bengaluru also recorded the wettest April in seven years, the coolest day of May in ten years and the wettest June in a decade.

329.title: Dharmendra and I used to play cards while travelling to 'Sholay' sets: Big B
329.article_body: Veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan, recalling the shoot of his 1975 film 'Sholay', revealed that he used to play rummy with Dharmendra while travelling to the film's set. "Dharmendra ji and I used to travel by...same car and it took us around 45-50 minutes to reach the sets from the hotel. We used to sit together and play cards," he said.

330.title: Cong’s Bharat Jodo Yatra bigger than Lord Ram’s padyatra: Raj minister
330.article_body: Rajasthan Health Minister Parsadi Lal Meena called Congress’ Bharat Jodo Yatra a "unique and historic" movement while adding that Rahul Gandhi’s march is much bigger than Lord Ram’s padyatra from Ayodhya to Sri Lanka. "Lord Ram had also travelled on foot from Ayodhya to Sri Lanka but now Rahul Gandhi will walk even more, from Kanyakumari to Kashmir," Meena added.

331.title: PM Modi with rapists: Rahul on release of Bilkis Bano case convicts
331.article_body: A day after the Gujarat government disclosed that the Centre approved the release of 11 convicts in the Bilkis Bano rape case, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that PM Narendra Modi "supports rapists". "He talks about women's respect from Red Fort, but in reality, he is with the rapists," he said, adding that PM has only cheated women.

332.title: ₹1 crore cash seized from BJP corporator's car in Telangana
332.article_body: Telangana's Nalgonda Police seized ₹1 crore in cash from a BJP corporator's car during a vehicle-checking drive, as per a police statement. At the time of the seizure, the corporator's husband was in the driver's seat, police added. The money was being transported by the husband from Vijayawada on the instructions of former MP G Vivek Venkatswamy, police stated.

333.title: Exxon fully exits Russia after assets worth $4 billion seized
333.article_body: ExxonMobil on Monday said it has completely withdrawn from Russia after the government expropriated its assets. The US oil company, which had valued its Russian assets at over $4 billion, owned 30% stake in oil project Sakhalin-1. "Russian government has unilaterally terminated our interests in Sakhalin-1 and the project has been transferred to a Russian operator," an ExxonMobil spokeswoman said.

334.title: Govt increases MSP on wheat by ₹110, mustard by ₹400
334.article_body: The Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs (CCEA) has approved an increase in MSPs for wheat by ₹110 to ₹2,125 per quintal and mustard by ₹400 to ₹5,450 per quintal for the current crop year. The MSPs for barley, gram, masoor, rapeseed and safflower was also increased. Currently, the government fixes MSPs for 23 crops.

335.title: YouTube ends trial that made 4K videos exclusive to Premium users
335.article_body: YouTube has ended a trial wherein some users were asked to become Premium subscribers to watch videos in 4K resolution. "We've fully turned off this experiment. Viewers should now be able to access 4K quality resolutions without Premium membership," a Twitter account of YouTube said. YouTube had launched the trial to know "the feature preferences of Premium and non-Premium viewers".

336.title: Man dies after being knocked down by tanker in Mumbai; driver arrested
336.article_body: A man died after he was hit by a tanker in Chembur, Mumbai on Monday. The 50-year-old deceased was walking with his wife before he was hit and died on the spot, police said. The accused tanker driver attempted to flee but was caught by locals and later got arrested. He has been booked under IPC sections 279 and 304-A.

337.title: UAE summons EU mission head over Borrell's racist 'jungle' remark
337.article_body: The UAE on Monday summoned the acting head of the mission at the European Union delegation to the UAE over EU foreign policy chief Josep Borrell's "inappropriate and discriminatory" comments. In his remarks at the new European Diplomatic Academy in Belgium last week, Borrell called Europe "a garden" and most of the world a "jungle" that "could invade the garden".

338.title: ONGC Videsh plans to retake 20% stake in Russia's Sakhalin-1: Report
338.article_body: According to reports, ONGC Videsh Limited (OVL), the overseas arm of state-owned ONGC, is making a proposal to retake 20 per cent stake in Russia's Sakhalin-1 oil and gas project. Vladimir Putin had transferred the project and all of its assets and equipment to a new operator after disbanding Exxon Neftegaz as operator of the Sakhalin-1.

339.title: Russia fines Amazon 4 mn roubles for not deleting illegal content: Report
339.article_body: A Russian court on Tuesday fined US-based e-commerce firm Amazon 4 million roubles (about $65,000) in two separate cases, Interfax reported. The court ruled that Amazon had failed to delete material relating to drug use and "propagandising suicide", both of which are illegal under Russian law. This is the first fine Amazon has faced in Russia.

340.title: #Punerains trends as city reports 3rd wettest Oct day since 2011
340.article_body: #Punerains started trending on Twitter as heavy rains continued to lash several areas of the city, leading to waterlogging and traffic congestion on roads. Pune city recorded 104.5 mm of rain in the 12 hours between 8.30 pm Monday and 8.30 am Tuesday. According to India Meteorological Department (IMD) data, this was the third wettest October day since 2011.

341.title: Cowardly act: Dy CM after 2 UP labourers killed in grenade attack in J&K
341.article_body: UP Deputy CM Brajesh Pathak condemned the incident where two labourers from UP were killed after terrorists lobbed a hand grenade in J&K’s Shopian. "Very unfortunate...Government is working to eliminate terrorists...Won't tolerate this cowardly act," Pathak said. Under PM Narendra Modi's leadership, work to uproot Pakistan-sponsored terrorism from India is being done, he stated.

342.title: Hasty response: Israel as Aus reverses recognition of Jerusalem as capital
342.article_body: Israeli PM Yair Lapid on Tuesday criticised Australian PM Anthony Albanese's government's decision to stop recognising west Jerusalem as his country's capital, reversing a 2018 decision by the previous government. Lapid described the move as a "hasty response". "We can only hope that the Australian government manages other matters more seriously and professionally," he added.

343.title: We will add donate option to Starlink: Elon Musk
343.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk has said the company "will add a donate option to Starlink". His remark came in response to a tweet by CEO of a fintech firm who said he'd like to donate Starlink's satellite internet service to schools and hospitals in Uganda. Musk then tweeted, "Are there others [who] want to donate Starlinks to places in need?"

344.title: Who are the new office-bearers of BCCI?
344.article_body: Roger Binny was elected as the new BCCI President during the board's 91st Annual General Meeting (AGM) held on October 18. Jay Shah has been elected the Secretary of the board for the second time in a row, while Rajeev Shukla remains the Vice President. Devajit Saikia and Ashish Shelar have been elected as Joint Secretary and Treasurer, respectively.

345.title: Sewage overflow near Hyd's Jahangir Peer Dargah causing inconvenience: Locals
345.article_body: Sewage overflow and bad road condition was reported near Hyderabad's Jahangir Peer Dargah. The local people said that the government and the concerned authorities in the Wakf Board are not paying attention to the difficulties being faced by them and pilgrims. Jahangir Peer Dargah is a 720-year-old shrine located in Inmulnarva village of Kothur Mandal in Ranga Reddy district.

346.title: What are the Kamikaze drones being used in the Russia-Ukraine war?
346.article_body: Kamikaze drones, which detonate on impact, destroying them in the process, have reportedly been used by both Russia and Ukraine in the ongoing conflict. The drones, which Ukraine and US say have been made in Iran, are also known as Shahed-136 drones and are made to hit specific targets with explosives. They loiter over their targets until instructed to attack.

347.title: 51-year-old man dies while performing dandiya raas in Gujarat; video surfaces
347.article_body: A 51-year-old man died while performing dandiya raas with sticks at a function at a relative's place in Gujarat's Dahod district. A video showed the man collapsing while performing raas, following which his relatives rush to his aid. He was rushed for treatment but was declared dead.

348.title: Didn't have clue she'd take such a drastic step: Vaishali Takkar's mother
348.article_body: Vaishali Takkar's mother said she didn't know that the television actress "would take such a drastic step" of ending her life. She said the accused, Rahul Navlani, was "adamant about making attempts" to get Vaishali's wedding called off, which was supposed to happen in December.
