"Vaishali has written that she'll get justice only after Rahul will be punished," she added.

349.title: Mumbai's oldest captive lion Ravindra dies at 17 due to age-related issues
349.article_body: The oldest captive male lion in Mumbai, Ravindra, died due to age-related issues on Monday. "He was under the medical supervision of the vet committee," Clement Ben, Additional Principal Chief Conservator of Forest (APCCF) Wildlife West, said. Reports said that Ravindra was brought to Sanjay Gandhi National Park from Bannerghatta Zoo on September 21, 2009, at the age of four.

350.title: Moscow has not notified about expected nuclear drills: US official
350.article_body: A US military official has said Russia has not yet notified about exercises of its nuclear forces that Washington expects Moscow to carry out. The US had said that Russia is likely to test launch missiles during annual "Grom" exercises of strategic nuclear forces. Russia is obliged to notify of missile launches under the New START Treaty, US official said.

351.title: Ranveer Singh accused of driving ₹3.9 cr car with expired insurance; Mumbai Police reacts
351.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has been accused by a Twitter user of driving his ₹3.9 crore Aston Martin with expired insurance. The Twitter user shared photos of Ranveer's car and insurance details and asked Mumbai Police to take action in the case. Meanwhile, Mumbai Police replied, "We have informed the traffic branch."

352.title: My goal this year is to grab a catch which could be one of my best catches: Hardik
352.article_body: Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya has said that his goal this year is to grab a catch which could be one of the best catches of his career. "I was always natural as a fielder, but I want to be exceptional. Now, I am able to spend some time on my skills and get those difficult catches," he said.

353.title: Cong chief poll sees 96% turnout, no adverse incident reported: CEA
353.article_body: Congress Central Election Authority (CEA) Chairman Madhusudan Mistry said about 9,500 of the total around 9,900 electors cast their votes in the Congress Presidential poll held on Monday. The overall voter turnout was 96% and in small states, it was nearly 100%, he added. "In all states where polling booths were set up, no adverse incident was reported," he stated.

354.title: India will not travel to Pakistan for Asia Cup 2023: Jay Shah
354.article_body: BCCI Secretary Jay Shah on Tuesday said that India will not travel to Pakistan for Asia Cup 2023. The BCCI will demand that the tournament be moved to a neutral venue, with Shah saying, "Neutral venue for Asia Cup is not unprecedented." The decision to not travel to Pakistan was taken at the BCCI's Annual General Meeting today.

355.title: UK should use local laws to deal with assault of HK protester: Lee
355.article_body: Hong Kong leader John Lee said the case of a pro-democracy Hong Kong protester allegedly assaulted inside the Chinese consulate in Manchester should be dealt with in accordance with local laws. British police launched an investigation after the man was filmed being dragged inside consulate and beaten by several men during a demonstration against Chinese President Xi Jinping on Sunday.

356.title: SDRF teams on spot, detailed inquiry ordered: U'khand CM on Kedarnath helicopter crash
356.article_body: Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami expressed condolences over the helicopter crash at Garud Chatti near Kedarnath. Seven people died in the incident. "SDRF & district administration teams have reached the spot for relief and rescue work. A detailed inquiry has been ordered into this tragic incident," state Chief Minister tweeted.

357.title: Ram Charan, wife Upasana head to Japan for 'RRR' promotions, pic surfaces
357.article_body: Actor Ram Charan has left for Japan to promote SS Rajamouli’s ‘RRR’ ahead of its release in the country on October 21. A picture of Ram with his wife Upasana Konidela and their dog Rhyme has surfaced on internet, which is being widely shared by his fans. The actor will also be joined by his ‘RRR’ co-star Jr NTR.

358.title: Had gone to Pak to perform a play, we were caught with alcohol: Sumeet
358.article_body: Actor Sumeet Vyas said he once went to Pakistan to perform a play, having crossed the Wagah border on foot. "[We were]...told...that...[we shouldn't] carry alcohol because it is not allowed...But as luck would have it, somebody [carried it]," added Sumeet. Sumeet stated that Pakistan's immigration officers were able to detect the presence of alcohol resulting in it being confiscated.

359.title: Centre in denial mode on Global Hunger Index ranking: Chidambaram
359.article_body: Former Finance Minister P Chidambaram alleged that the Centre was in a denial mode about the Global Hunger Index ranking. "The first task of any government is to overcome the challenges of poverty, hunger and malnutrition...The report released on 17-10-2022 has confirmed that 27.39 crore were lifted out of poverty in the 10 years of the UPA government," said Chidambaram.

360.title: 1st phase of Delhi-Mumbai Expressway to be completed this year: Gadkari
360.article_body: Speaking on the status of the Delhi-Mumbai Expressway, Union Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari claimed that work on the first phase from Delhi to JNPT in Mumbai would be completed this year itself. "My plan is to connect Nariman Point to Delhi making it a 12-hour journey," said Gadkari. The expressway will be approximately 1,350 km long.

361.title: Sachin Tendulkar names his semi-finalists for T20 World Cup 2022
361.article_body: Cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar named the teams which according to him would feature in the semi-finals of T20 World Cup 2022. The 49-year-old stated that Australia and England could reach the semi-finals from Super 12 stage's Group 1, while India and Pakistan are likely to advance from Group 2. "I would obviously want India to be the champions," he stated.

362.title: Who won what at 2022 Ballon d'Or awards ceremony?
362.article_body: At 2022 Ballon d'Or awards ceremony, Barcelona's 18-year-old Gavi won Kopa trophy for the best under-21 player. Barcelona's Robert Lewandowski won the Best Striker of the Year award. The Yashin Trophy for the best goalkeeper was awarded to Real Madrid's Thibaut Courtois. Men's Ballon d'Or award was won by Karim Benzema, while Barcelona’s Alexia Putellas won women's Ballon d'Or award.

363.title: 6 killed, 15 injured after bus rams into trailer in Gujarat's Vadodara
363.article_body: As many as six persons were killed and nearly 15 others were injured after a bus rammed into a trailer on the Ahmedabad-Mumbai national highway in Gujarat's Vadodara on Tuesday, police said. The bus was going towards Surat from Rajasthan, police added. The accident happened when it tried to overtake the trailer on a bridge on the highway, police stated.

364.title: Extremely unfortunate: Jyotiraditya Scindia on Kedarnath helicopter crash
364.article_body: Reacting to the helicopter crash incident in Uttarakhand, Union Minister for Civil Aviation Jyotiraditya Scindia said that it is an "extremely unfortunate" incident and he was in touch with the state government to ascertain the magnitude of the loss. Six people, including two pilots, were killed after a helicopter carrying Kedarnath pilgrims from Uttarakhand's Phata crashed on Tuesday morning.

365.title: Stones hurled at police who went to raid Ghaziabad godown; 2 hurt
365.article_body: Two police personnel were injured after stones were hurled at a police team who reached a village in Ghaziabad to raid a godown allegedly used to store illegal firecrackers worth over ₹80 lakh, officials said on Monday. The police team went to the village for the raid based on a tip-off. Fourteen people were arrested, the Circle Officer (City) said.

366.title: Anti-Semitic & insulting: White House on Trump's comments on US Jews
366.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump's comments that American Jews have offered insufficient praise for his policies toward Israel were "insulting" and "anti-Semitic", White House said. "No President has done more for Israel than I have," Trump said on Truth Social. While in office, Trump moved the US Embassy to Jerusalem and recognised Israeli sovereignty over the Golan Heights.

367.title: Suzlon Energy's shares rise after bagging Adani Green Energy order
367.article_body: Suzlon Energy's shares surged on Tuesday after the renewable energy solutions provider said it has secured an order from Adani Green Energy to develop a 48.3 MW wind power project in Gujarat. This is a repeat order from Adani Green, in addition to the existing 226.8 MW order. Suzlon Energy's stock was trading 4.70% higher at 12:53 pm on NSE.

368.title: UP govt hikes DA for employees, pensioners to 38% ahead of Diwali
368.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government has increased the Dearness Allowance (DA) and Dearness Relief for employees and pensioners to 38% ahead of Diwali, CM Yogi Adityanath tweeted on Monday. The state government will also give a bonus of ₹6,908 to all its employees for the financial year 2021-22, he said. The hiked DA will be effective from July 1, 2022.

369.title: China speeding up plans for unification with Taiwan: US
369.article_body: China is pursuing unification with Taiwan "on a much faster timeline" than previously expected, US State Secretary Antony Blinken said. If Beijing cannot achieve unification by peaceful means it would use "coercive means" and "maybe forceful means", he added. Blinken reiterated that the US would honour its commitments to Taiwan and support the island's ability to defend itself.

370.title: Bodies of pregnant woman, husband found hugging each other after drone attack in Ukraine
370.article_body: The bodies of a 34-year-old pregnant woman and her husband were found in an embrace after a drone attack on an apartment block in Ukraine's Kyiv recently, her colleagues said. She was six months pregnant, they added. "Vladimir Putin can score another 'conquest', he killed another pregnant woman," Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said.

371.title: I say 'Sorry for hitting, hit me later if you wish': Big B on action scenes
371.article_body: Discussing the bond that he shares with actors who play villains in his movies, actor Amitabh Bachchan said, "When there are action scenes...[I]...apologise saying, 'I'll have to hit you, forgive me. You may hit me later'." Talking about his film 'Sholay', Amitabh stated, "Dharmendra and I used to travel [in] the same car...We used to sit together and play cards."

372.title: 66% Indian CEOs predict recession to hit in next 1 year: KPMG survey
372.article_body: About 66% CEOs in India expect a recession to hit over next one year and 86% predict it will impact company earnings by up to 10%, according to KPMG 2022 India CEO Outlook. The survey revealed that 58% leaders in India expect a recession to be short and mild. About 62% CEOs in India said recession will upend anticipated growth.

373.title: Hope they do well: Maanvi Gagroo on 'Tripling 3' & 'Four More…' clash
373.article_body: Actress Maanvi Gagroo said she's hoping that the third season of her upcoming shows 'Tripling' and 'Four More Shots Please!', releasing on October 21, "do extremely well". Talking about having two releases on the same day, Maanvi said she reminds herself to be grateful as it's not something that happens with many actors. "I'm just soaking it in," she added.

374.title: Shot for Radha song, there were 100+ dancers: Sidharth on 'Student...' 1st day
374.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra said that he shot for the song 'Radha' on his first day of shooting for 'Student Of The Year'. "I was very nervous. It was very overwhelming...to be...choreographed by Farah Khan. There were some hundred plus dancers, Manish Malhotra doing our clothes and [we were] getting our hair and make-up fixed amid shaadi ka setting," Sidharth added.

375.title: Will there be new dawn?: Sibal after Justice Chandrachud appointed as next CJI
375.article_body: After Justice DY Chandrachud was appointed the 50th CJI, senior lawyer Kapil Sibal tweeted, "Will there be new dawn when Justice Chandrachud takes over?" Furthermore, he said, "DY Chandrachud next CJI…Not surprised anymore at what this government does: Granting remission to rapists-murderers." "Not surprised...by what the court does: Stays acquittal in a special hearing on a Saturday," he tweeted.

376.title: Roger Binny appointed as new BCCI President
376.article_body: Roger Binny has been appointed as the new BCCI President, replacing Sourav Ganguly. This comes as the BCCI held its Annual General Meeting (AGM) at the Taj Hotel in Mumbai. Earlier, reports said that Ganguly was offered the post of IPL Chairman, however, he declined it. Reports also said that BCCI won't back Ganguly for the post of ICC Chairman.

377.title: Wipro signs 5-yr deal with Finland-based stainless steel firm Outokumpu
377.article_body: Wipro announced a five-year deal with Finland-based stainless steel manufacturer Outokumpu to boost the latter's cloud transformation for applications. As part of the deal, Wipro will help Outokumpu become a sustainability-focused organisation. Outokumpu is known for tailoring stainless steel into any form or for any purpose. Wipro's stock was trading 1.77% higher at 11:54 am on NSE on Tuesday.

378.title: Commission probing Jayalalithaa's death orders inquiry against Sasikala, doctor
378.article_body: The report of Justice Arumughaswamy Commission, which probed the death of former Tamil Nadu CM J Jayalalithaa, has ordered an inquiry against her close aide VK Sasikala and a doctor. The report also ordered an inquiry against former Health Minister C Vijayabaskar and former Health Secretary Radhakrishnan. Tamil Nadu government tabled the report in the Assembly on Tuesday.

379.title: Got scared: Ankit Tiwari on meeting fan who was threatening to self harm
379.article_body: Singer Ankit Tiwari said he "got scared" when he met his fan who threatened to harm himself if the singer wouldn't meet him. A video of the incident had recently gone viral on social media platforms. Describing the moment as "shocking", Ankit said he spoke to the fan, who later "apologised for creating the ruckus".

380.title: Honda commemorates 25 years of Honda City in India
380.article_body: Honda celebrated the completion of 25 years of Honda City in India, which was launched in 1998 and is currently in its fifth generation avatar. It has remained the longest-running mainstream model in the Indian automotive history, revealed Honda. The vehicle has a cumulative sales of over 9 lakh units in domestic and export markets.

381.title: New foot-over bridge at Khar Road station in Mumbai opens for public
381.article_body: The Western Railway has opened a new foot-over bridge at the Khar Road station of Mumbai Suburban section. The 44-metre-long and six metre wide new foot-over bridge has been opened for public use on the south side of the station. The new foot-over bridge has come up at a cost of ₹4.55 crore, a senior Western Railway's official said.

382.title: 'Kantara' took me back to my roots, had goosebumps: Shilpa Shetty
382.article_body: In an appreciation post for actor-director Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara', actress Shilpa Shetty said that the film took her back to her roots. "What a narrative, emotion, vibe and world. Had goosebumps during the climax," she wrote, adding that 'Kantara' is a must-watch for "the sheer brilliance of storytelling". She also praised Rishab for his conviction and versatility as an artist.

383.title: UP man goes on hunger strike after daughter elopes with boyfriend
383.article_body: A man has been on a hunger strike for the past five days in Uttar Pradesh's Bijnor after his 18-year-old daughter eloped with her boyfriend and took ₹3 lakh cash from the house. The girl was supposed to get married to a boy of her parent's choice on October 15. The SHO said that a case has been filed.

384.title: 6 people killed as helicopter carrying Kedarnath pilgrims crashes
384.article_body: Six people, including two pilots, were killed after a helicopter carrying Kedarnath pilgrims crashed in Uttarakhand, officials have said. The helicopter was carrying pilgrims from Phata, reports said. An administration team has left for the spot for relief and rescue work, reports added.

385.title: Some iPhone 14 users complain of 'SIM not supported' bug, Apple says probing issue
385.article_body: Some Apple users complained about the 'SIM not supported' bug on iPhone 14 recently. As per a memo seen by MacRumors, Apple acknowledged the SIM-related bug in some iPhone 14 devices and stated that after displaying the pop-up message on the screen, the iPhone may entirely freeze. Apple said that while it's investigating the issue, it isn't a hardware problem.

386.title: Ali Fazal shares burning poster of Sajid Khan, says 'evict him from Bigg Boss'
386.article_body: Actor Ali Fazal shared a story on Instagram, appealing that MeToo accused Sajid Khan should be evicted from Bigg Boss 16. He shared a picture showing burning poster of Sajid. This comes amid controversy over Sajid's participation in the show after at least 10 women accused him of sexual harassment and inappropriate behaviour.

387.title: Iran supplying drones to Russia violates UN resolution: US
387.article_body: The US State Department on Monday said that the US agrees with the French and British assessment that Iran's supply of explosive drones to Russia violates UN Security Council Resolution 2231. The resolution, linked to Iran's 2015 nuclear accord, bars Iranian transfers of certain military technologies. Ukraine has reported a spate of Russian attacks using Iranian-made drones in recent weeks.

388.title: Cong condemns AAP's remark against PM's mother, says she is 100 yrs old
388.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel condemned AAP's Gujarat chief Gopal Italia for his remark against PM Modi's mother and said that Heeraben is 100 years old and has nothing to do with politics. He further claimed that AAP is the "B" team of the BJP and they go to Gujarat, Goa and Uttarakhand to defeat the Congress.

389.title: Youths record videos of mismanagement at Bihar hospital, beaten by nurses
389.article_body: Two youths were beaten with sticks by nurses for allegedly recording videos of mismanagement at Chapra District Hospital in the Saran district of Bihar. Reports said that the youths had come to the hospital to collect their medical certificates but started recording videos. Reports added that no police complaint was lodged in the incident.

390.title: Youth creates ruckus at Hyd petrol pump after argument over payment
390.article_body: A youth allegedly created ruckus at a petrol pump in Hyderabad’s Bahadurpura after an argument with an employee over online payment for fuel. The youth called two of his friends and they purportedly ransacked the office and attacked the cashier. Later, one of them took out a gun and moved around. Police reached the spot and arrested one of them.

391.title: Stray dog pulls out one-year-old baby's intestines, bites him to death in Noida
391.article_body: A one-year-old baby died after he was mauled by a stray dog in a housing society in Noida, police said. The baby was admitted to ICU after his intestines were pulled out in the attack. "The parents of the child are construction workers. Both were engaged in construction work inside the society," police added.

392.title: Will suspend driving licence of repeat offenders: Maharashtra Dy CM
392.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis has said that the driving licence of people fined more than five to six times for violating traffic norms will now be suspended for a few months. The Maharashtra government has also decided to set up a special squad to monitor vehicles involved in lane jumping along the Mumbai-Pune Expressway.

393.title: Delhi policeman arrested over 'promising' jobs to youths in Punjab Police
393.article_body: Ludhiana Police arrested a Delhi Police constable and booked three others for allegedly cheating youths of lakhs by "promising" them jobs in Punjab Police. The accused allegedly gave a question paper to the victims claiming that a similar one would appear for Punjab Police's constable recruitment written test. The constable had been absent from duty for more than a month.

394.title: Australia reverses recognition of West Jerusalem as capital of Israel
394.article_body: Australia has reversed its recognition of West Jerusalem as the capital of Israel. Foreign Minister Penny Wong said that Australia is committed to a two-state solution, in which Israel and a future Palestinian state co-exist within internationally recognised borders. In 2018, former Australian PM Scott Morrison's government recognised West Jerusalem as Israeli capital.

395.title: Samvardhana Motherson's stock falls to 52-week low after block deal
395.article_body: Auto component firm Samvardhana Motherson's shares fell by 6% on Tuesday's early trade to a 52-week low after 14.6 crore shares reportedly changed hands in multiple trades representing a 4.6% stake worth ₹952 crore. The deal was done at an average of ₹65 per share. At 11:30 am, its stock was trading 6.72% lower at ₹64.55 apiece on NSE.

396.title: 12 trapped amid flooding caused by heavy rainfall rescued in Pune
396.article_body: After heavy rainfall caused waterlogging and flooding incidents in Pune, the fire brigade rescued at least 12 people who were trapped in rain-related incidents. The fire brigade officials said that one person was also injured after a tree fell. Moreover, 30 families from a village were shifted to safer areas as a precautionary measure on Monday, district administration officials said.

397.title: SEBI approves proposed IPOs of 4 companies
397.article_body: SEBI has approved the proposed initial public offerings (IPOs) of four companies, which are BIBA Fashion Limited, Keystone Realtors Limited, Plaza Wires Limited and Hemani Industries Limited. Warburg Pincus and Faering Capital-backed BIBA Fashion had filed the Draft Red Herring Prospectus for an IPO in April. Rustomjee group firm Keystone Realtors filed the preliminary papers for IPO in June.

398.title: Nora Fatehi denied permission to perform by Bangladesh govt to save forex reserves
398.article_body: Bangladesh government has denied dancer and actress Nora Fatehi permission to perform at an event in its capital Dhaka. Fatehi wasn't granted permission "in view of the global situation and with the aim of maintaining the foreign exchange reserves," Bangladesh's Ministry of Cultural Affairs said. She was scheduled to dance and hand out awards at an event.

399.title: GWR officially declares Monday as 'worst day of the week'; Twitter users react
399.article_body: Guinness World Records took to Twitter to officially declare Monday as the "worst day of the week". Reacting to the tweet, users wrote, "Took you long enough," and, "I totally agree." "I take Mondays off just for this reason," and, "That feeling of Sunday evening is much more worst than Monday morning," other users tweeted.

400.title: Parts of Bengaluru to face power cuts today and tomorrow
400.article_body: Parts of Bengaluru will face power cuts on October 18-19 as Bangalore Electricity Supply Company (BESCOM) and Karnataka Power Transmission Corporation will be undertaking some maintenance works. Most of these outages might occur between 10 am and 4 pm, with some works starting by 9 am. BESCOM divisions which will remain affected today are - Kanakapura, Ramanagara and Tiptur.

401.title: Mom sent me sunscreen but I don't use it: Rahul Gandhi on being told he has tanned
401.article_body: Speaking to Congress workers during the party's 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', Rahul Gandhi was told that he has tanned and was asked as to what sunscreen he used. Responding to the workers, Rahul said, "I don't use any sunscreen." When told that "there is some tanning visible", he said, "My mom has sent some (sunscreen), but I am not using it."
